description: It's like strawberry jam, only without sugar.
//: Cheap for three liters of spread!

description: Dried strips of sugary fruit paste.
It's like blueberry jam, only without sugar.
Yellow cling peach slices packed in light syrup.
Canned pineapple rings in water.  Quite tasty.
Tangy yellow powder that smells strongly of lemons.  Can be mixed with water to make lemonade.
It's like fruit jam, only without sugar.
//: this item is intended to generally be inherited from the fruit that was cooked.

description: Fresh fruit, cooked with sugar to make them last longer.
Dehydrated fruit flakes.  With proper storage, this dried food will remain edible for an incredibly long time.  They are useful for several cooking recipes.
//: most of the water weight and volume is lost

description: Reconstituted fruit flakes, which are much more enjoyable to eat now that they have been rehydrated.
Fruit slices soaked in a sugar syrup, to preserve freshness and appearance.
This sodden mass of preserved fruit was boiled and canned in an earlier life.  Bland, mushy and losing color.
A festive autumnal bread with a golden color in either rolls or sliced loaves of bread.
Whole fruits preserved in 40 proof or higher alcohol.
//: this item is intended to generally be inherited from the fruit and alcohol used.
